title: Synthetic Recap
body:
MIAMI — On a night when defense ruled and points were at a premium, Tim Hardaway put on an offensive clinic for the ages. The Miami Heat point guard authored a historic performance, pouring in a game-high 42 points to single-handedly dismantle the Orlando Magic in a 102-90 victory.

In a contest defined by gritty, late-90s basketball, Hardaway’s explosion was a stunning anomaly. While his teammates combined for 60 points, Hardaway was a one-man whirlwind, slicing through the Orlando defense with a mesmerizing display of scoring. His 42 points weren't just high; they were monumental, accounting for over 41 percent of the entire Heat offensive output.

The Magic, led by Nick Anderson's 22 points, simply had no answer. Every time Orlando threatened to close the gap, Hardaway had a response—a deep three-pointer, a twisting drive to the hoop, or a pull-up jumper that silenced the run. His performance was the entire narrative, a dominant force that overshadowed every other aspect of the game.

On a night where both teams struggled to reach 40 percent shooting from the field, Hardaway’s efficiency was devastating. He didn’t just score; he carved up the opposition with a willful, breathtaking display of individual brilliance. The final score tells a story of a Heat win, but the history books will remember this as the night Tim Hardaway took over and delivered one of the most unforgettable individual performances of the era.
